stimulusHtml: How many gallons of water enter the tank during the time interval  0 ≤ t ≤ 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF2@ ? Round your answer to the nearest gallon.

features.html:
The amount of water in a storage tank, in gallons, is modeled by a continuous function on the time interval 0≤t≤7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF2@ , where t is measured in hours. In this model, rates are given as follows:

  1. The rate at which water enters the tank is f( t )=100 t 2 sin( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@449D@  gallons per hour for 0 ≤ t ≤ 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF2@ .

  2. The rate at which water enters the tank is g ( t ) = { 250    for  0 ≤ t < 3 2000  for  3 < t ≤ 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5631@  gallons per hour.

 

The graphs of f and g, which intersect at t = 1.617 and t = 5.076, are shown in the figure above. At time t = 0, the amount of water in the tank is 5000 gallons.
